required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tele-Coaching Intervention to Improve Treatment Adherence in Cystic Fibrosis
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility, Acceptability, and Pilot Randomized Controlled Trial of a Tele-Coaching Intervention to Improve Treatment Adherence in Cystic Fibrosis

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, multicenter pilot study to investigate the feasibility and preliminary effectiveness of a tailored tele-coaching intervention to enhance medical adherence in patients with CF.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective, multicenter pilot study to test the feasibility and acceptability of a tele-coaching intervention and its implementation in patients with CF (ages 14-25 years), and to obtain estimates of treatment effects across a range of key outcome measures (e.g., global adherence, change in treatment barriers, specific improvement in adherence, etc.)

primary_outcome.description: Patient attrition will be measured as the percentage of participants who do not receive a sufficient dose of the intervention.

primary_outcome.measure: Intervention acceptability for patients assessed by Likert scale
primary_outcome.description: This measure was developed for this specific study to evaluate feasibility and acceptability of the intervention through aspects of usability, quality, and satisfaction. Assessed by 5 point Likert Scale: Strongly disagree, Disagree, Neither Agree or Disagree, Agree, Strongly Agree.

primary_outcome.measure: Intervention acceptability for coaches assessed by Likert scale
primary_outcome.description: This measure was developed for this specific study to evaluate feasibility and acceptability of the intervention through aspects of usability, quality, and satisfaction. Assessed by 5 point Likert Scale: Strongly disagree, Disagree, Neither Agree or Disagree, Agree, Strongly Agree.

Recruitment and feasibility will be evaluated using the percentage of screen failures which are the number of eligible participants who do not score at least a three on any given treatment component for the CF-CBS amongst all eligible participants.

secondary_outcome.description: Assess the preliminary effect of intervention on treatment adherence from data collected from vest photo capture and eTrack nebulizers. Vest photo capture will be scored as a ratio of total minutes used to total minutes prescribed in the study period. Medication adherence will be scored as a 'per drug analysis' of adherence with a ratio of competed to total prescribed doses in the study period. A composite score will be determined based on prescribed medications and medication/doses taken.

The CF-CBS (Cystic Fibrosis Care Behaviors Survey) will be used to analyze barriers to treatment. Measure will be based on an overall decrease (difference in means) in barrier specific frequency, specific treatment total barriers and the composite score for barriers from pre-intervention to post-intervention.

other_outcome.description: We will compare the Self-Reported Adherence measure and the CF-CBS Self-Reported Adherence using Pearson Correlations.

arm_group.description: 6-months of 11 web-based intervention (tele-coaching) sessions (9 biweekly sessions and 2 monthly sessions) of approximately 30 minutes each; continued use of eTrack nebulizer and vest monitor photo capture as measures of adherence.

intervention.description: Patients will meet with a "tele-coach," who is a care team member, via video-calling, on a regular basis for six months to identify and address treatment adherence concern(s).

facility.name: Washington University School of Medicine in St Louis
University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

responsible_party.investigator_title: Co-Chair of Success with Therapies Research Consortium
